SRE: Site Reliability Engineering — applying software engineering practices to operations.
SLO: Service Level Objective — reliability target for a service.
SLI: Service Level Indicator — metric used to measure reliability.
SLA: Service Level Agreement — contractual reliability commitment.
MTTR: Mean Time To Recovery — average time to restore service.
MTTD: Mean Time To Detect — average time to discover incidents.
MTBF: Mean Time Between Failures — average uptime between failures.
RTO: Recovery Time Objective — maximum acceptable downtime.
RPO: Recovery Point Objective — maximum acceptable data loss window.
HA: High Availability — design to minimize downtime.
DR: Disaster Recovery — restoring service after catastrophic failure.
BCP: Business Continuity Plan — plan to keep operations running during disruption.
IaC: Infrastructure as Code — managing infra using code.
CI: Continuous Integration — automated build and testing of changes.
TOIL: Manual repetitive operational work that doesn’t scale.
RCA: Root Cause Analysis — investigation into incident cause.
PIR: Post Incident Review — structured analysis after an incident.
PSA: Problem Summary Analysis — documented incident review.
SOP: Standard Operating Procedure — documented task instructions.
KPI: Key Performance Indicator — measurable performance metric.
APM: Application Performance Monitoring — tracking app performance metrics.
NOC: Network Operations Center — team monitoring infrastructure.
SOC: Security Operations Center — team monitoring security events.
IAM: Identity and Access Management — managing authentication and permissions.
RBAC: Role Based Access Control — permissions based on roles.
ABAC: Attribute Based Access Control — permissions based on attributes.
MFA: Multi Factor Authentication — multiple identity verification methods.
SSO: Single Sign On — one login for multiple systems.
TTL: Time To Live — how long data is cached before expiry.
DNS: Domain Name System — resolves names to IP addresses.
DHCP: Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol — assigns IP addresses.
NTP: Network Time Protocol — synchronizes system clocks.
TCP: Transmission Control Protocol — reliable transport protocol.
UDP: User Datagram Protocol — fast but unreliable transport protocol.
HTTP: Hypertext Transfer Protocol — web communication protocol.
SSL: Secure Sockets Layer — legacy encryption protocol.
LB: Load Balancer — distributes traffic across servers.
ELB: Elastic Load Balancer — cloud-managed load balancer.
WAF: Web Application Firewall — protects web apps from attacks.
CDN: Content Delivery Network — distributed content caching system.
QoS: Quality of Service — guarantees on network performance.
NAT: Network Address Translation — maps private to public IPs.
VPN: Virtual Private Network — encrypted network tunnel.
VPC: Virtual Private Cloud — isolated cloud network.
CIDR: Classless Inter Domain Routing — IP addressing notation.
BGP: Border Gateway Protocol — internet routing protocol.
OSPF: Open Shortest Path First — internal routing protocol.
ARP: Address Resolution Protocol — maps IP to MAC address.
MAC: Media Access Control — hardware network address.
WAN: Wide Area Network — large geographic network.
SAN: Storage Area Network — high-speed storage network.
NAS: Network Attached Storage — shared file storage.
IOPS: Input Output Operations Per Second — storage performance metric.
CPU: Central Processing Unit — primary compute resource.
RAM: Random Access Memory — volatile system memory.
GPU: Graphics Processing Unit — parallel compute processor.
KVM: Kernel Virtual Machine — Linux virtualization technology.
HVM: Hardware Virtual Machine — fully virtualized VM.
PaaS: Platform as a Service — managed application platform.
IaaS: Infrastructure as a Service — virtualized compute resources.
SaaS: Software as a Service — hosted software delivery.
FaaS: Function as a Service — serverless compute model.
BaaS: Backend as a Service — managed backend services.
API: Application Programming Interface — service communication interface.
SDK: Software Development Kit — tools for building apps.
CLI: Command Line Interface — text-based system interface.
GUI: Graphical User Interface — visual system interface.
YAML: YAML Ain’t Markup Language — config file format.
JSON: JavaScript Object Notation — data interchange format.
XML: Extensible Markup Language — structured data format.
CSV: Comma Separated Values — tabular data format.
ETL: Extract Transform Load — data processing pipeline.
RDBMS: Relational Database Management System — structured DB engine.
NoSQL: Non Relational Database — flexible schema data store.
SQL: Structured Query Language — database query language.
ACID: Atomic Consistent Isolated Durable — transaction guarantees.
CAP: Consistency Availability Partition tolerance — distributed system tradeoffs.
BASE: Basically Available Soft state Eventually consistent — NoSQL model.
OOM: Out Of Memory — system ran out of RAM.
FD: File Descriptor — reference to open file.
CRON: Command Run On — scheduled task runner.
CI/CD: Continuous Integration and Delivery — automated pipeline.
MR: Merge Request — GitLab equivalent of PR.
VCS: Version Control System — tracks code changes.
SCM: Source Control Management — code versioning system.
GitOps: Operational model using Git as source of truth.
HPA: Horizontal Pod Autoscaler — scales pods based on metrics.
VPA: Vertical Pod Autoscaler — adjusts pod resource limits.
CRI: Container Runtime Interface — container runtime API.
CSI: Container Storage Interface — storage plugin standard.
PVC: Persistent Volume Claim — storage request in Kubernetes.
ISO: International Organization for Standardization image format.
BIOS: Basic Input Output System — firmware boot interface.
UEFI: Unified Extensible Firmware Interface — modern firmware.
SLAAC: Stateless Address Auto Configuration — IPv6 address assignment.
IPAM: IP Address Management — tracking IP allocations.
DDoS: Distributed Denial of Service — traffic flooding attack.
IDS: Intrusion Detection System — security monitoring system.
IPS: Intrusion Prevention System — attack blocking system.
SIEM: Security Information Event Management — centralized security logs.
EDR: Endpoint Detection and Response — endpoint security monitoring.
CVE: Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures — public vulnerability ID.
CVSS: Common Vulnerability Scoring System — severity rating.
SOC2: Service Organization Control 2 — security compliance framework.
PCI: Payment Card Industry — payment security standard.
HIPAA: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act — US health data law.
GDPR: General Data Protection Regulation — EU privacy law.
PII: Personally Identifiable Information — sensitive personal data.
PHI: Protected Health Information — healthcare sensitive data.
DLP: Data Loss Prevention — data protection controls.
CASB: Cloud Access Security Broker — cloud security enforcement.
ZTNA: Zero Trust Network Access — identity-based network security.
ZTA: Zero Trust Architecture — trust nothing security model.
